pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:5.1: 21. The training rule on arms akimbo
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were walking in inhabited areas with arms akimbo. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:7.2: “‘I will not walk in inhabited areas with arms akimbo,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:8.1: Walking in an inhabited area, one should not have one’s arms akimbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, has one or both arms akimbo while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:9.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:9.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:10.1: The first training rule is finished.
